Creates a stream of engrams on the skin's surface, forming a layer that deflects lightning strikes. Many people carry it to prevent accidents at the Bafaria Ruins.
Subterranean monsters secrete a similar substance. It reacts to earth and sand containing engrams and seems to be able to move smoothly underground.

Fossilized fang that seems to belong to the dragon race found in "The Claw Mark of the Giant Dragon". It is heavy and gives off an eerie sense of intimidation.

An ore that can be found in "Robbery Traces Behind the Waterfall". It's often used by adventurers, so it's used all over the city. It contains a lot of impurities, and it takes a little time to process.
A small part used in Bafaria's inheritance that protects the pillar of God. It seems to hold various powers, but its structure and principle are not well understood.

I am Kozu.
I've been an adventurer for quite a while now, working as an Aegis Fighter.
As an Aegis Fighter who supports the frontlines and ultimately the party, there are many techniques to learn.
What do you think? How about completing a request with me?
You might pick up a thing or two about being an Aegis Fighter.
It's also a good thing for me to have reliable companions added to my side.

Hey, I'm Kozu, the Aegis Fighter.
It seems that monsters have been appearing in Minsterhorn.
They're quite aggressive, targeting livestock and people intensively.
So, there's a request for a skilled Aegis Fighter who can fight while protecting.
It would be reassuring to have you join. Could you lend your strength if you come?

Hey, it's Kozu, the Aegis Fighter.
I'm looking to borrow your strength again, are you up for it?
The task I have right now is to deliver the 'High Helm Beans'.
I've heard there's another favor to ask afterward. Seems like it might require a bit of a hand.
I don't think it'll get too rough, but having you here would be reassuring.
Counting on you.

Hey there, it's Kozu, the Aegis Fighter.
I don't have a clear picture yet, but something unsettling seems to be happening around Litzeh.
I've taken up a request to investigate and if there's indeed something going on, they want us to do something about it.
Could I ask for your help with this task again?
I'm planning to head to Litzeh soon, would you be up to join me?

It's Kozu, the Aegis Fighter.
Remember when I asked for your help in Litzeh before? Well, it seems that something has indeed happened.
There are reports of powerful monsters appearing around Litzeh, and apparently, one of them has a history with me.
I'm asking for your assistance once again.
I need your strength for this.
Would you lend a hand?

I'm Manuel! The Twin Striker destined to become a hero someday!
Are you a Twin Striker too? If you are, let's team up to defeat <value type="enemyName" id="E006_00_00_01001"/>!
Actually, a friend who was supposed to go with me got sick with a stomachache.
That friend is also a Twin Striker, so it would be easier if another Twin Striker like you could join.
Let's polish our skills together! Counting on you!

I'm Manuel! I'm a Twin Striker aiming to become a hero someday! I've received a request to defeat <value type="enemyName" id="E000_00_00_01001"/>. Would you like to come along again?
I want to introduce you to my friends as well. I want to say, 'We've got this amazing person with us, someone like the heroes we aspire to be!' Hehe, let me boast a little about knowing you.
So, I'm counting on you! Thanks!

I'm Manuel! I'm a Twin Striker aiming to become a hero someday!
There's this amazing technique that the hero Ahim used. Its name is 'Vortex Impact'!
Pretty cool, right?
I really want to learn and use that technique too! Could you help me figure out how to learn it?

I'm Manuel! I'm a Twin Striker aiming to become a hero someday!
I'm currently practicing the 'Vortex Impact'.
I feel like I need just a little more insight to take the next step.
So, I'm thinking of visiting places connected to the heroes.
You could call it a pilgrimage to their holy sites?
There might be hints about becoming a hero left behind there.
Wanna come along?

I'm Manuel! A Twin Striker aspiring to become a hero someday!
The legendary tale of Hero Ahim's Quad Arm subjugation...
I've always wanted to give it a shot.
So, I found <value type="enemyName" id="E003_00_00_02001"/>, but something's off.
If left alone, it might attack Ritze!
Would you fight alongside me to protect Ritze?

Hello there! I'm Lili, the Blast Archer.
Are you interested in becoming a Blast Archer?
Of course, you are! I mean, just look at that expression on your face!
Let's walk the path of the Blast Archer together!
And if things align, perhaps you could even assist me with the tasks I've been assigned...
Let's support each other as fellow Blast Archers, shall we? Right?

Hello there! I'm Lili, the Blast Archer.
I was amazed at how quickly you've mastered the bow.
You definitely have the talent of a Blast Archer!
With a little more practice, you'll be making a big impact in no time!
Actually, I thought of taking on a request to defeat <value type="enemyName" id="E000_00_00_01001"/>.
Since we're at it, how about we tackle it together? What do you say?

Hello! I'm Lili, the Blast Archer.
How about some practice with the bow? You see, there's something I'd like to try out. If you're up for it, I'd love for you to join me.
It's a type of battle unique to Blast Archers – aerial combat!
Monsters flying in the sky can be quite tricky opponents, but we can attack them from a distance.
To be prepared for when the time comes, let's start training now!

Hello there! I'm Lili, the Blast Archer.
I found it! The one we're looking for – the 'Sky Serpent'!
Someone from Ritzeh said they spotted it along the way.
Since it was just a short while ago, it should still be around that area!
My brother's nemesis! Please, I'm begging you, lend me your strength!

Hello there! I'm Lili, the Blast Archer.
I've been searching for the 'Sky Serpent' tirelessly, and I've finally found it!
The creature's nest is located in <value type="locationName" id="fld003_E"/>.
With the nest as our reference, we won't let it escape or lose sight of it.
This time, we'll settle the score for sure! Please, fight alongside me!

I... What was it, my name?
...Sela, right. Yes, I'm Sela. Uh-huh.
As Sela, I have a favor to ask.
I need to defeat several <value type="enemyName" id="E006_00_00_01001"/>, but due to unavoidable circumstances, I can't do it myself.
I'm cornered from all sides, truly in a bind.
If it's okay, would you lend a hand to me, who is Sela?

Hey there, I'm Sela, the Spellcaster.
...It's a bit complicated.
This time, I need some ore that can be collected in the Asteria Plains, as well as engrams from <value type="enemyName" id="E000_00_00_01001"/>.
The former might be straightforward, but the latter would involve some fighting, I assume.
Still, I absolutely need both for my objective.
Could you please lend me your strength? I'm begging you.

I am Sela, the Spellcaster.
Or rather, I am the Imagiin possessing Sela. It's getting even more complicated, isn't it?
To set things right and return the body to Sela, I need your assistance.
I want to extract an engram from the grave of a great individual.
For us Spellcasters, this person is like a common ancestor... but I wonder if you're interested?

I am the Imagiin possessing Sela, the Spellcaster.
I wish there were a way to make this long introduction easier.
This time, I want to gather the living engrams of Sela, who I inhabit. I've found some of the tools she used when she was alive.
However, both are located within monster nests.
I'm in need of your help. Could you lend a hand?

I am Slavt, the Imagiin inhabiting Sela, the Spellcaster.
I'm truly grateful for your help in gathering the engrams.
I've been preparing to return Sela's body, but time is running short.
I can no longer hear Sela's voice.
If things continue like this, Sela's consciousness will likely fade away before long.
This is my final plea as the one within Sela.
Could you please consider my request?

Hey there! I'm Masquita. Nice to meet you!
So, you're a Heavy Smasher too? Awesome. That exhilarating feeling of taking down enemies with a powerful blow—unbeatable, right?
Alright, since we're here, I'll give you a little lecture on Heavy Smasher weapons.
How about we go smash up some <value type="enemyName" id="E005_00_00_01001"/> together? After all, practice makes perfect!

Hey there, it's me! Masquita here.
How's the training as a Heavy Smasher going? This time, I'd like you to help me out with a little task.
I need to defeat <value type="enemyName" id="E000_00_00_01001"/> in <value type="locationName" id="fld001_E"/>. Simple, right?
Actually, my mentor told me to "learn to cooperate with allies", I can't do it alone.
I think this would be a good learning experience for you too, so how about joining me?

Hey, it's me! Masquita here.
I was thinking of going on a little journey to find my mentor, but I heard something troubling.
It seems a child from Minstahorn went out towards <value type="locationName" id="fld001_N"/> and hasn't returned.
We've received help from those folks there before, so I can't just let this slide.
I'm hoping you could lend a hand. Can you help out?

Hey there, it's me! Masquita here.
I went to Ralpar to look for my mentor, but there's a bit of a commotion going on.
The supplies and goods we had stored there were ransacked, or so I've heard. It feels kind of familiar, in a way... It's been bothering me.
I want to go to Ralpar and investigate. Could you lend a hand?

Hey there, it's me! Masquita here.
Remember the goods being ransacked in Ralpar? It was the work of a pack of Highland Foxes.
The exact same thing seems to have happened again!
This time, the pack was led by a 'Sapphire Trot.' I remember that one. It's someone I lost to back in the day!
This time, we're definitely taking down the 'Sapphire Trot'!

I'm Carant. I'm a Blitz Lancer, your senior!
You must be the new Blitz Lancer, right?
I want to teach you how to fight in this class.
I was also taken care of by my seniors, so now it's my turn to properly teach my juniors!
First, let's try taking down some monsters together.
The quickest way to get stronger is still through real combat!

Hey there! I'm Carant, your senior Blitz Lancer.
How's the training as a Blitz Lancer going?
As your senior, I'll teach you something new again!
But you know, just fighting all the time can get boring, right? I felt the same way.
I've got a good request from the Pioneer's Guild, so let's do that while practicing as Blitz Lancers.
Keeping our juniors engaged is also a duty of a senior, you know!

Hey there! I'm Carant, your senior Blitz Lancer.
I hate to admit it, but could you lend me a hand?
Right now, I've got two requests I need to tackle – one for defeating monsters and the other for gathering resources. I got a bit carried away and accepted them both at once...
It's looking like I won't be able to finish them on my own!
I'm sorry! Could you please help me out?

Hey there! I'm Carant, your senior Blitz Lancer.
Remember that spear called the 'Zenith Shaft' my senior was searching for?
I found a merchant who seems to know about it!
I want to go and look for the 'Zenith Shaft.' I think if I can find it before my senior does, it'll be a huge growth opportunity for me.
I want to hear what they have to say, so could you lend me a hand?

Hey there! I'm Carant, your senior Blitz Lancer.
Seems like there's an Ogre in Montenore Valley.
I'm curious about that. It's close to where the adventurer with the 'Zenith Shaft' went missing.
And to top it off, the Ogre appeared recently.
There's a chance Rugel might not know about it yet.
Would you investigate this with me for clues about the 'Zenith Shaft'?

Upon waking up, I found myself in an unfamiliar place.
I couldn't recall anything except my own name. It seemed I was experiencing amnesia of sorts.
By my side was a demi-human girl named Feste. It appeared that she had taken a liking to me after I rescued her from a goblin.
However, I couldn't help but wonder how I had become her 'servant' without realizing it...
The place where I encountered Feste was said to be a 'ruin that had been recently discovered.' There might be clues to my memories there.
When considering the future, it seems advantageous to become an adventurer for various reasons. I should aim to pass the exam and complete adventurer registration.

My life as an adventurer has begun. By accepting requests, meeting people, and traveling through various lands, it will naturally lead to searching for my memories.
First, I plan to take on the well-paying job that Jake is going to introduce me to.
I wonder what the job entails exactly...

In 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon,' I encountered the legendary monster 'Abalitia.' Furthermore, I heard the word 'Visitor' from a mysterious boy named Melrouth who descended from the sky.
Could these things be related to the lost memories?
I would like to investigate further, but Feste insists on going to the 'Coin Inn' and won't listen.
It's because Jake has convinced her that 'the innkeeper will treat us'...

I was able to hear about the 'Visitor' from the priest Walquin and his disciple Milreine of the Buffaria Religion.
The 'Visitor' refers to foreigners with special powers.
It seems that the secret lies within the 'Divine Pillar of Revelation,' the largest sacred site of the Buffaria Religion, which stands tall in the Bahamahr Highlands.

At the 'Divine Pillar of Revelation,' I met Eirinze and Tiris, who came from a thousand years in the future.
The two of them intend to release Abalitia and save this world from the impending future of destruction.
I decided to cooperate with them in this endeavor.
Without delay, it seems Tiris has a request to make.

The abnormal reaction of the Engrams that appeared in Omnistrone.
There is a high possibility that it is Abalitia.
Let's cooperate with Eirinze and the others to successfully release Abalitia.

A request from the innkeeper of Coin Inn.
It seems like a simple errand, but the item to be delivered is quite a dangerous thing with the message, 'Once you've tasted it, there's no turning back.'

While deeply engrossed in conversation with a stray cat, Feste suddenly asked, 'Go and fetch me some 'Horn Goat Meat.' This is also a task for her servant, so I'll comply without asking any questions.

A simple job of delivering a letter to the priest of Minsterhorn.
However, hidden within is a secret of Jake's that must not be touched.

I was entrusted with a job from the innkeeper of Coin Inn, saying, 'Originally, it should have been given to someone else.'
It seems wise to be prepared for some level of danger.

Suddenly, Tiris began to inquire with a completely unfamiliar boy.
Did she come across some crucial information...?
Her expression was filled with a mixture of urgency and determination.

Eirinze and Tiris are engaged in some intriguing conversation.
It might be possible to catch a glimpse of a part of the mysterious duo's secret, who claim to be from the future.

A detestable wealthy person approached me with a job offer.
They claim to want to donate an exorbitantly expensive and exquisitely rare item that would pique the interest of the Oracle Priestess.
Asterleys - Go to Two-sided Coin Inn 1F
Bahamar Highlands - Deliver the Meat for servants
Asterleys - Go to the Top Floor of the Development Bureau
Montegnor Valley - Talk to High Priest at Pilgrim Group
Asteria Plains - Talk to Feste at Ministerhorn
Bahamar Highlands - Talk to Tyris at Larpal
Bahamar Highlands - Talk to Feste at Larpal
Montegnor Valley - Talk to Feste at Ritze

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I received the acceptance notice from Poalier and completed all the tasks.
In the middle of it, Fovi showed up and started arguing with Poalier, but acceptance is acceptance.
Now I can register as an adventurer.
I should go report to Muiry.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

In the depths of the 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon,' I encountered an exceptionally powerful monster and managed to defeat it.
According to Feste, this monster is a being that transcends time and space called 'Abalitia.'
Why does a monster, considered to be a legend in adventure tales, exist?
And what does it mean that I, the one who defeated it, did...?

Jake headed to the pioneering station ahead of me, saying "We need to draw attention to Abalitia" and went to report.
Then, a young boy descended from the sky.
The boy introduced himself as Melrouth and left a mysterious whisper about a 'Visitor.'
Could that be related to my memories in some way?
Feste seems to recognize the word, but can't remember from where.
For now, I should return to the pioneering station and collect my reward from Jake.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I rescued Waurkin, who was attacked by monsters at the 'Ruins of the Giant Tower.'
When I inquired about the 'Visitor,' Waurkin started passionately explaining his theories.
The 'Visitor' refers to foreigners with special powers. In some circles, they are even considered bringers of calamity.
Waurkin posited that the founder of the Buffaria Religion might have been a 'Visitor' from another world and was consequently demoted from the headquarters of the church.
He fervently argued that by investigating the 'Divine Pillar of Revelation,' the largest sacred site of the Buffaria Religion, we might gain insights into the 'Visitor.'
...In any case, Waurkin was found safe and sound.
I should report to Milreine in Minsterhorn Village.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

On the top floor of the 'Divine Pillar of Revelation,' Abalitia was sealed.
As I approached, suddenly a dazzling sphere of light formed, and two girls appeared from within. Furthermore, Abalitia was unsealed and began to rampage, attacking the girls.
We managed to repel Abalitia, but the identity of the girls remains unknown. They are also being watched with great caution.
And then, at that moment—
The walls of the room shattered, and a new intruder appeared.
The king of the largest and strongest dragon race, Voldegen.
His overwhelming power devoured Abalitia and effortlessly defeated the elite guards.
Voldegen aimed at us and slowly approached.
There was no escape, only the option to fight.
At that moment, the girls conjured a sphere of light. They jumped into the light as it called to them.
Enveloped in a sense of floating, when the light disappeared—Voldegen vanished suddenly, and Abalitia, supposedly defeated, was sealed on the ceiling.
It was as if nothing had happened at all.

I explained the situation to the two girls.
Their names are Eirinze and Tiris. They leaped through time with 'Chronoleap,' escaping from Voldegen.
It's an unbelievable story, but as they were trying to leave the 'Divine Pillar of Revelation,' they passed by 'themselves and Feste' who were entering... They saw their past selves. They truly leaped through time, returning to the past.
Perhaps due to the effects of Chronoleap, Eirinze seemed to be in pain.
For now, we decided to return to Ralpar to calm down.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I obtained the parts that Tiris asked for.
I should deliver them right away.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

The one that reacted to Omnistrone was indeed Abalitia.
After defeating Abalitia, Eirinze performed the 'Rite of Liberation.' Abalitia, shrouded in numerous solemn lights, disappeared as if guided by Eirinze.
"An existence born from the temporal distortion of killing one's past self." That is Abalitia.
Only Eirinze can correct that distortion and restore the twisted causality.
However, the ritual is also a taxing act that greatly exhausts Eirinze.
To let Eirinze rest, we decided to return to Ritzeh once more.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Upon returning from the cliffside ruins, I spoke with Jake once again, and he introduced me to the guide of the pioneering station, Muiry.
Upon seeing the 'Imagin' I obtained from the ruins, she immediately recognized it as a 'Goblin' Battle Imagin.
While not particularly rare, it seems like a fortunate find.
To become an adventurer, I need to take an exam.
Muiry will be in charge of it, so I'll get the detailed information from her later.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

After completing the registration exam, I officially became an adventurer.
Now I can take requests from the pioneering station. However, Muiry advised me not to forget about raising my 'Adventurer Rank.'
The higher the rank, the greater the adventurer's abilities, and you can take on higher-rewarding requests or venture into dangerous places.
To increase the rank, I need to clear 'Adventure Boards.' I received the first one from Muiry.
Additionally, for defeating the ogre in the 'Lakegrid Mine,' I was rewarded with 'GC (Glory Coins).'
I heard that you can exchange various items at the 'Commemorative Exchange Center.'
Jake mentioned, "Once you become an adventurer, I'll introduce you to well-paying jobs."
I'll go visit Jake to report and also hear about his suggestions.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I received the reward for the request and some intriguing information from Jake.
Lately, unidentified creatures have been sighted in various places. Rumor has it that these might be Abalitia.
Furthermore, the timing of the increased sighting reports coincides with the period when the dragonkin started acting up.
Jake plans to continue investigating this information.
By the way, the innkeeper at Coin Inn seems to offer a treat as a celebration for completing requests.
Upon hearing that, Feste exclaimed, "Let's go to Coin Inn!" with a noticeable change in her expression.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

As soon as Warlkin and Mirelene saw each other, they began a heated discussion about the 'Tower Ruins' and ancient civilizations.
It's great to see them spirited... but it seems like they won't be listening to my questions anytime soon.
The secret of the 'Visitor' might be within the 'Divine Pillar.'
Next, let's aim for that place.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Eirinze and Tiris have come from a future 1000 years ahead.
Their purpose is to free Abalitia.
Abalitia warps spacetime just by existing, and the accumulated distortions will eventually consume this world.
Before long, this planet and the entire world will be annihilated.
In an era with fewer distortions like the present, they can still address the issue. That's why they've arrived in the current time through Chrono Leap.
However, Chrono Leap is a critical secret that must not be known by anyone.
With a sword in hand, Tiris posed the choice, "Cooperation or death."
There's no choice but to cooperate to save the world.
Neither Eirinze nor Tiris wish to force anyone's hand, and they bowed their heads when I gave my answer.
And so, I have joined in assisting Eirinze and Tiris in liberating Abalitia.
I'm a bit worried about having been led on by Feste to sign a servant contract with Tiris...

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

While Tiris is repairing Omni Stronghold, I had a conversation with Eirinze.
People like them who have arrived through Chrono Leap were once referred to as 'Visitors.'
Eirinze can perceive the fluctuations of Engrams unique to the 'Visitors.' However, she doesn't see any distinguishing features of a 'Visitor' within herself.
Could what Melrouf said have been incorrect?
After repairing Omni Stronghold, when it was activated, there was a reaction in Montenol Valley.
Eirinze and Tiris are planning to move ahead while conducting an on-site investigation. For communication, a sub-device of Omni Stronghold was handed over to me.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Tiris expressed both apology and gratitude regarding the events leading up to the liberation of Abalitia.
It seems she had her own internal struggles about it.
To avert the future of destruction, Eirinze must continue with the liberation of Abalitia.
However, the Dragon King Voldeigen stands in their way. According to Tiris, Voldeigen is also an Abalitia, and he enhances his power by consuming other Abalitias.
If they don't liberate Abalitia before Voldeigen, he will absorb the power and distortions, and once again, this world will face ruin.
In order to protect the world and save the future, I once again promised to assist Eirinze and Tiris with their efforts.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

First, let's greet the innkeeper of this lodging.
Head to the counter on the first floor.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Feste seems to be acquainted with the innkeeper of the "Two-Faced Coin Inn."
And apparently, it seems there's a growing tab for lodging fees...
The innkeeper gave advice, saying, "If you're leaving the town, make sure to prepare properly."

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

The name of the town is Astelries.
It's said to be the largest trading city in the Magna Continent. Buildings stand side by side, and the streets are bustling with many people.
Truly a grand city.
Let's head to the "Town Gate Plaza" located at the entrance of the town first.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

A massive teleportation portal is placed in the Town Gate Plaza.
It's said that by using this, you can instantly return to the city.
Touch the teleportation portal to register yourself.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I registered the teleportation portal at Astelries' Town Gate Plaza.
Preparations are now complete.
Let's head outside the town and try to find clues about my memories.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

As I left Astelries, a vast plain stretched out before me.
This is the "Asteria Plains."
Various plants, minerals, and more can be found here, along with scattered ruins of Bapharia.
And ahead, monsters will also appear. I must stay vigilant.
Let's head towards the "Cliff Ruins" where I met Fest.
There might be clues about my memories there.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I got into a fight with Goblins at the "Cliff Ruins."
Some monsters seem to act in groups, so I need to be careful in battles.
This place deep within is where I met Fest. It's where I woke up.
Will I find something here?

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I found an "Imagine" at the place where I woke up. It's a crystal that binds the essence of an Engram and a creature.
It holds various powers, but it doesn't seem to be a clue to my memories. I couldn't find anything else.
As I tried to leave, I thought I heard a strange voice, but there was no one there.
When I left the ruins, I met a adventurer named "Jake." He has a casual way of speaking but is well-known in Astelries, and he also seems to be the leader of the adventurers' group.
Jake promised to introduce me to the Pioneer's Guild if I become an adventurer. Even Fest encourages me to register as an adventurer.
He said, "You might be curious about your memories, but first comes money!"...
Nevertheless, having no job would be troublesome too. I should head to the Pioneer's Guild and listen to Jake's story.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

To become an adventurer, you need to clear several tasks.
The first task is to defeat the "Landfox."
Don't let your guard down. Make sure to prepare before you take on this challenge.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Successfully defeated the Landfox.
Let's report back to Mewri.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

The second task is to explore the 'Lakeclad Mine'.
It's an old mine located in the 'Seabreeze Prairie'.
While monsters have taken residence there after its closure, the danger level isn't too high.
If you reach the deepest part, the task will be considered completed.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

You can enter the 'Lakeclad Mine' through the 'Starline Passage'.
Starline Passages are scattered throughout different places, connecting to various locations such as ruins and caves.
Once you find one, remember its location.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I hadn't heard about such a formidable enemy like an Ogre appearing in the 'Lakeclad Mine'.
According to Fest, "It's too tough for rookie adventurers."
Nevertheless, I managed to defeat it somehow.
With this, I should be able to proceed to the next test challenge.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

The presence of an Ogre in the 'Lakeclad Mine' seems to have been an unexpected situation even for the Development Bureau.
I received thanks from Muri for reporting the discovery and the subjugation.
However, the examination is a different matter. I need to clear the next challenge.
The third task is to "Learn about Crafting."
Starting with crafting a weapon. Let's go to the 'Craftsman Plaza' and hear more details from Fuovi.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I learned the necessary steps for crafting weapons from Fuovi.
After obtaining the recipe and gathering the required materials, it seems I can use the 'Transmutation Sphere' to create a weapon.
In the registration test, the task is to actually craft a weapon.
I should gather the materials and craft a weapon from the 'Adventurer's' series using the 'Transmutation Sphere.'

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I successfully crafted a weapon from the 'Adventurer's' series.
Now I just need to have Fuovi confirm it for me.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I was able to successfully complete the third task as well.
The final task is crafting an 'Enhance Imajin.'
It seems that Poarié at the 'Imajin Research Institute' is in charge of this.
The institute is located just outside the Pioneer's Guild. Let's pay them a visit right away.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

Poarié provided me with detailed information about the task.
An 'Enhance Imajin' is an 'Equippable Imajin' that enhances one's physical abilities when worn.
For adventurers, it's just as important as a weapon.
To craft an Enhance Imajin, you'll need a recipe and materials, just like crafting a weapon.
The task requires crafting the 'E-Uriuri Uribou' Enhance Imajin.
Collect the necessary materials and then head to the Imajin Research Institute to have it crafted.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I successfully crafted the 'E-Uriuri Uribou' Enhance Imajin.
I should have Poarié confirm it for me.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I'm heading out with Jake to take on a monster hunt.
Apparently, a boar-like creature has appeared in the 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon'. It's tougher than the average monster, a "bit of a challenge".
The reward for this request is also quite substantial.
I'll meet up with Jake in front of the 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon'.

◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇　　　　　◇

I met up with Jake in front of the 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon'.
Together with Fest and Jake, let's explore the 'Claw Marks of the Giant Dragon' and take down the monster.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ "The husband treats me" was a trap for Jake to get Feste to eat a drink... After a moment of quarrel, Feste brought up the word "visitor" left behind by Merlouf. My husband told me that it might be related to the Bafarian religion. But I don't know the details. Asterlise has a huge Bafarian temple. So I decided to ask him about the "visitor".

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ "Don't blindly say 'a visitor'." However, a girl who was watching me from behind a pillar told me, "If you go to the Minsterhorn, you'll understand something." The mysterious girl suddenly disappeared when I took my eyes off her. There are no other memories or clues to the 'visitor'. Follow the girl's instructions and go to Minsterhorn.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I met a woman named Millene at the Minsterhorn. It seems that her teacher, a priest named Warkin, is very knowledgeable about the "Visitors". However, Warkin did not return after going to investigate the Ruins of the Great Tower. I accepted the request from the worried Millene. Let's go to the Ruins of the Great Tower to find Warkin.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ ``Kamikake no Mihashira'' is the most sacred place of the Bafarian religion, where it is said that the founder of the Bafarian religion descended. As a result, I was turned away by the gatekeeper saying, "You can't enter without permission." Even if Feste flatters you, it seems that you can't do anything that you can't do. Can I get a permit somewhere? Let's have a strategy meeting at Larpal.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ In Ralpal, I heard a rumor about a Bafarian pilgrim group. Recently, the town of Berkmaar was destroyed by a strange monster. A Bafarian pilgrim group is visiting to mourn the victims. The pilgrim group also includes high-ranking people such as the chief priest and the oracle maiden. Maybe I'll get permission to enter "Kamikake no Onbashira". Let's go to Berkmaar and meet the pilgrims.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ In Berkmaar, I reunited with the mysterious girl I met at the temple of Asterries. When I told him that I wanted to enter the ``Kamikake no Onbashira'', she gave me a permit for some reason. Who the hell are they? Before I could ask the question, the girl left again. Anyway, I got my license. Let's show it to the gatekeeper of "Kamikake no Onbashira".

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ When I showed him the permit I got from the pilgrim girl, the gatekeeper couldn't hide his surprise. The permit appears to be genuine. After getting lost, the gatekeeper finally let me through. Now you can enter the pillar of God. Seek clues about the "visitor" and aim for the top floor.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Tiris and his friends have a device called "Omnitron" that searches for Avalitia. However, it seems that it was damaged in the battle at "Kamikake no Onbashira". I was asked to collect parts for repair. Let's head to "Valley of Traces" and get the parts.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Tirith and the others contacted the slave unit of Omnistron. It seems to be able to deliver not only voice but also text. it's amazing. Tiris seems to be tense because she is Erinze's only escort. Erinze also said that she was sorry. Until you get used to it, it would be better for me to hand over a little. Let's meet up with the girls who went ahead of us at Ritze in "Montnor Valley".

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ When I arrived at Ritze, I came across a group of Bafarian pilgrims. There was a girl who gave me a permit to enter "Kamikake no Onbashira". She was the "oracle shrine maiden" Einlein. I don't know why you gave us your power. The pilgrims left before I could speak to them. A series of attacks by dragons and the appearance of monsters have spread anxiety among the people. Avalitya is one of them. I hope that releasing Avalitya with Erinze and the others will lead to peace... Now let's follow Omnistron's reaction.
Fragments of Everyday Life and Beyond

The next Abaritia to be released seems to be in the Silent City managed by the Bafaria Order. Feste is quite enthusiastic that there may be treasure in the ruins with few adventurers coming and going. It's supposed to be about a world crisis, but...
The next Abaritia to be released seems to be in the desert. There is a checkpoint on the highway that leads to the desert. I have to go through there.
This is the Evergreen Desert. It's the stage for new adventures. Omnistron's reaction is towards the desert. Let's head towards the city of Salamzat first.

Came to Bafaria Temple in Salamzat to seek information about Avalitia. Omnistron cannot be used now that the glowing wind is blowing. Erinze said that if it was a temple, she might be able to hear about Abaritia, but...

Diva Charlotte I met at the entrance to the desert. It seems that the performance of Jilwet Tabi Troupe, which she belongs to, will begin. Erinze was looking forward to it, and Einlein also wanted to see it. I have a promise with Charlotte. Let's go see the performance together.
Carvaine and Charlotte are forced to hide in a hideout. Apart from that, Einlein has a request. It seems that it is difficult to talk in the temple.

We joined Erinze and the others and talked about Carvain, Charlotte, Einlein and York. It seems that Erinze and Tiris have something to worry about. He said he was talking about an old man, but he seemed at a loss as to what to say.
Electra seems to have something to ask. Something to do with the Bafalia Cult?
After crossing the scorching desert, we finally arrived at Salamzat Oasis. Sweets are the best way to heal the fatigue of a long trip. Tiris decided to serve a cake for Erinze.
Tiris says he has something he wants to do personally. "Something suspicious..." Feste senses that something interesting is bound to happen, and decides to follow her.
York was in trouble. When I ran away from the insect, I lost the piece of paper that was in my notebook. It is said that it is not written in a personal diary, but...
"I want you to find the missing believer."
Vice Commander Veronica of the Knights of the Principality of Bernhardt. Will the day come when those thoughts will reach the person who has hidden them in her heart...?
Avalitya reacts to Omnistron! But it wasn't a target to release. Should I defeat it or not... What decision did Tiris make?
Erinze and Tiris visit Asterries for the first time. The two, who saw everything fresh, enjoyed a momentary rest.

Montegnor Valley - Talk to Gatekeeper at Checkpoint
Evergreen Desert - Go to Hermit's Fountain
Asterleys - Go to entrance of the Bafaria Temple
Evergreen Desert - Talk to friends at Windless Wasteland

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Defeated Abaritia in The Silent City. When we arrived, a young man was already fighting Abaritia. Despite his efforts, he collapsed and was unable to move. While Erinze is performing the ceremony of liberation, I decided to carry the young man to a place to rest. The Bafaria cult garrison should be nearby. let's go there

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Defeated Avalitya in "Dawn's Bug Fortress". This is another Avalitya that should be released. Erinze steps forward for the Liberation Ceremony. At that moment, Avalitia, who should have fallen, stood up with a terrifying life force. There, a shadow descended from overhead. With one thrust of the spear, this time Avalitia sank to the ground. Dunkirk, the leader of the Knights of the Principality of Bernhardt, appears. It seems that he was investigating this ruin with his subordinates. After Dunkirk and the others left, Erinze safely released Abaritia. For now, let's go back to Einlein and tell him not to worry about Avalitia. On the way back, Tiris was a little behind, perhaps because there was something on her mind. What there was wonder?
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Charlotte returned to her troupe. Carvain said he was going to join his friend, so he left. A lot of things happen and I feel tired. Let's take a break at the rest station.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ York was the son of Dunkirk, the captain of the Knights of the Principality of Bernhardt. Both Einlein and Carvain are childhood friends, and they are still close friends. York has something to investigate personally, and it seems that Einrein and others are lending their strength to it. However, the content was successfully overlooked. Maybe it's something you don't want people to know. Einlein's errands are done. Yoruk seems to be staying here, and has been asked to deliver Einrein to Salamzat.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ A mysterious old man told an old story about a priest. There was a woman who admired the priest. "Alicia's blessing" is said to be the words that woman said. The priest searched for the "sand wind flower" that the woman had asked for. It is said that during that time, he was enveloped in a dazzling light and landed in a strange land with a completely different people and culture. And it's been a long time. At the old man's request, Tiris smiled awkwardly while holding the 'Sand Wind Flower' in her hand. Seeing that, the old man nodded in satisfaction. And when I said that I would deliver my thanks to the resting place, he quietly left.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Defeated Avalitia in Whispering Cliffs. With the glowing wind subsided and Omnistron ready for use, it became clear that this was the Avalitya that should be released. While Feste caught Elektra's attention, Erinze was able to complete the release ceremony. However, a disturbing shadow suddenly appeared there. The Dragon King Voldigen has appeared, and Elektra has also revealed her true form as the Dragon Tribe Hrelbe. On Voldigen's orders, she infiltrated the Bafalia cult. And he was watching Erinze activate the living engram by liberating Abaritia. Voldigen's goal is to eat Erinze and gain power. Both Erinze's condition and whereabouts were all out of sight from Frelbe. In front of the overwhelming power of Voldigen, his companions fell helplessly. When Erinze was caught and about to be eaten. The Imagine Seed I received from Carvain shone, and a beautiful singing voice flowed out. Woldigen suffered from singing and flew off into the sky. Before he could catch his breath, Hrelbe, who had turned into a giant dragon, attacked him. After a deadly battle, she disappeared into a deep valley. I can no longer see it. The threat of the dragon tribe has passed. Feste, Erinze, and Tiris managed to survive somehow.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ The recovered young man called himself Carvain. It seems that he was investigating something in "The Silent City". It seems that Abaritia was also expected to be there, but how did you know? As a thank you for helping me, Carvain gave me the Imagine Seed, which is said to be his greatest treasure. The moment I received it, a strange sight popped into my mind. --Somewhere a boy is swinging a sword. In the meantime, someone was watching him--when he came to, Carvain had already left. Ask for more details next time we meet. Erinze and Tiris also finished releasing Abaritia and joined up. Our next destination is the desert. It's the one with Salamzat.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was able to pass through the checkpoint safely. Now you can go to Salamzat. I am looking forward to experiencing different cultures in different places.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Arrived at Salamzat. At the same time, a glowing wind broke the flow of engrams. Omnistron became temporarily unusable, and Abaritia's whereabouts became unknown. Then, Erinze suggested going to the Bafarian temple. He said that he might be able to obtain information about Abaritia at the temple.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Einlein also seemed to care about Abaritia. He seemed relieved to hear that there was nothing to worry about. Cheers rose from the square. It seems that Charlotte's traveling troupe is about to start a performance. There is also an appointment with Charlotte, and Erinze is happily leaning forward. It's good to take a breather once in a while.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I had a strange dream. ――In the forest, someone is holding my body. I can't move, and I hear screams. "Mother," over and over again―― When I opened my eyes, there was a bag of small money by my pillow. Then I saw Charlotte's back as she left. Feste also seemed to have noticed, and the two of them chased Charlotte to the entrance of the city. Charlotte seems quite concerned about being attacked by an armed group. Fearing that his troupe members might get involved, he tried to hide himself. There, Carvain and Einlein called out. The two are friends, and Einlein wants to help Charlotte no matter what. Furthermore, Carvain was a member of the Knights Order of the Principality of Bernhardt, which made him perfect for protecting Charlotte. Carvain says he's going into hiding for some reason. It was said that Charlotte would also hide there. Convinced, Charlotte left town with Carvain. Now you won't have to worry about her. On the other hand, Einlein told me that there was something he wanted to ask. When you've calmed down, let's listen to her talk.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ When I returned to Salamzat, Elektra caught Einlein in anger. It seems that Einlein somehow manages to cover up York. For now, this matter will be over. Erinze and Tiris should have rested as well. Let's join the two.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ A young man came to the resting place at the request of an old man. That old man is said to have died. What was delivered as a thank you was a commemorative coin of the Bafarian religion. It is quite old and probably dates from the founder's time. There is no way to ascertain the truth of what happened to the old man. The "Sand Wind Flower" shattered in Tiris' hands and disappeared. As if to say goodbye to the end of a long journey――
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ It's been a long day. So many things happen, so much to think about. Let your body rest now. Then look for the answer.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Head to the Silent City in the Andorra Basin.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ You have arrived at the Silent City. Find treasure and pay off debt! Tiris warned Feste, who was enthusiastic about it, that the top priority was to release Abaritia. Avalitya is in the back. Aim to release the second Avalitya.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ At the checkpoint, I was asked to present a guarantor. This appears to be a new condition, as no one knew about the guarantor. Due to Dunkirk, the knight commander of the Principality of Bernhard, who is suffering from political instability, he is visiting Salamzat, so he seems to be on high alert. The requirement for a guarantor is at least 10 years of residence in Asterleys. According to Feste, the owner of the coin shop has been running the shop for a long time, so there is no problem as a guarantor. I'm going to have to turn back, but I can't help it. Let's go to Asterleys.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was almost mistaken for the co-guarantor of the debt by the owner of the coin shop. Erinze and Tiris said things like "new servants" and "senior servants", and the husband's eyes gradually grew colder, but... Anyway, he conditionally agreed to be my guarantor. The husband uses Imagine Seed to contact his brother. It's broken, so I'd like to fix it. It requires some special materials, so I want you to collect them.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was able to collect materials for repairing Imagine Seeds. Deliver it to the owner of the coin shop.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ The owner of the coin house accepted me as a guarantor. They also provided me with a certificate. You should be able to pass the checkpoint with this.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Shortly after entering the desert, I found travelers fleeing from monsters. It is said that the girl acted as a decoy to attract the monsters so that they could escape. As soon as I went to help, I came across a Bafarian priestess who was unusually strong. After hearing the story, she also came to look for the girl who was used as a decoy. A shrine maiden takes care of the surrounding monsters. Find a girl now.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was able to save a girl who was being chased by a monster. she is charlotte. It is said that she is a diva of a traveling troupe that is scheduled to perform in Salamzat. He said he was confident in his speed, but it was unreasonable. Hearing that he was a traveling performer, Erinze's eyes lit up. Charlotte also invited me to the performance, and I promised to go see it. Charlotte left with the companions who came to pick her up. It's safe and above all. Let's aim for salamzat here too.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ In the temple, there was a shrine maiden, Electra, whom I met in the desert. She is said to be the escort of the oracle shrine maiden Einlein. However, Einlein suddenly disappeared, and he is looking for it. According to Erinze, "If you're an oracle shrine maiden, you'll have detailed information about Abaritia." I decided to help Electra find Einlein.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Einlein was playing with the children in the back of the Reclamation Bureau. They were talking about the 'Beast' that once destroyed the world, but the children seemed bored. Instead, Feste sang a beautiful song. The sound appealed not only to children, but also to Einlein. When Feste was teaching a song, Electra came there. When I asked Einlein about Abaritia, who was taken back, she told me that she was in the "Dawn Mushi Fortress". Why did Erinze think that the shrine maiden of the oracle knew where Abaritia was? I didn't get a clear answer from her.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Charlotte's stage began with cheers. But it soon turned into a scream. An unidentified armed group suddenly attacked her. Charlotte ran out of town. Armed groups are also chasing them. Needless to say to Einlein. I have to go help Charlotte immediately.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ The one who protected Charlotte when she was cornered was Carvain, whom she met in The Silent City. The two of them worked together to disperse the armed group and were able to save Charlotte. Tirith, who rescued the injured, also joined. The city seems to have calmed down. However, Charlotte doesn't seem to have any idea that her life was targeted. On his way back to Salamzat, Karvain dropped an old button. It is said that it is a clue left behind by the group that kidnapped his mother. Carvain may have complicated circumstances.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Einlein keeps a secret from Electra and the others, saying that he wants to meet his friend. It seems that he wanted to ask for that escort. Take her to the Hermit's Fountain in the Evergreen Desert.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Einlein's friend Yolk was nowhere to be found in the Hermit's Fountain. Instead, his handkerchief, his footprints, and a dead bug were left behind. It is said that yolks are very afraid of bugs, and even the smallest of them can draw their blood out of them. Even worse, if you were attacked by a large insect monster, your life might be in danger. Hurry up and find York.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ An insect monster appeared at the end of Yolk's footprints. Will York be okay?

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ After defeating the swarming insects, a young man appeared from the shadows. he's a yolk It seems that he was able to escape from the insect and was safe. York seemed to be showing a little toughness to Einlein who was worried. I can't stand talking here and be attacked by insects again. Let's go back to the safe tent.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ A certain old man in Salamzat said that he may have been Chrono Leap. If so, we can't leave it alone. Just in case, let's listen to the old man.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ The old man muttered, "Alicia's blessings..." at the bar. It's definitely the activation word for Chronogate. The old man who saw Tiris suddenly became conscious. I was so shocked that I couldn't even speak. The old man asked me to deliver the "Sand Wind Flower". It seems to be a flower that someone liked. He promised to tell me everything he knew if I gave it to him. "Sand Wind Flowers" are created by chance in the wind of the desert, and it is not clear where they are. Let's ask Einlein here. If it's the information network of the Bafaria cult, something might get caught.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was able to hear from Einlein and Elektra. A few years ago, it seems that the "Sand Wind Flower" was found in the "Borom Ruins".

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Got "Sand Wind Flower" in the depths of "Borom Ruins". Her beauty captivated the eyes of Erinze and Tiris. Both of them seemed so moved that their bodies trembled. I wonder if that old man also sought this out of beauty. Deliver the "Sand Wind Flower" to the old man in Salamzat.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Elektra requested subjugation of Abaritia. Avalitia appeared on the route of the pilgrimage, and they came to the conclusion that it would be better to subdue them rather than detour around them. Einlein heard about Electra's subjugation of Avalitya in the Dawn Mushi Fortress, which led to the request. Feste was also rounded up with a single word, “Booming the reward.” In any case, Avalitya cannot be left alone. Let's meet up with Electra and head to subdue Abaritia.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ It seems that Avalitya appeared in the Whispering Cliffs. Elektra said, "Originally, the cult should be responsible for Abaritia." It is said that the Bafaria Cult has sealed Abaritia in the Holy Land, and is collecting and using a huge amount of engrams from there. I couldn't hide my surprise at the unexpected truth. Elektra quickly mumbled, but it was too late. It seems that Erinze also knew about the connection between the Bafaria cult and Abaritia. Come to think of it, Avalitya was also sealed in the Chronogate of ``Kamikake no Mihashira''. It seems that Erinze will talk about the situation after finishing this Abaritia case. Now go to Whispering Cliffs and subdue Avalitya.
What Happened in Half of Year?
Overcame fierce battles not only with Abaritia, but also with the dragon king Voldigen and the dragon tribe Frelbe. Now take some rest.

Erinze was taken away to the future by Bachelard. According to the voice heard from Imagine Seed, it seems that Erinze will be used for some kind of 'plan'. At this rate, Erinze's life is in danger. Let's go to the future with Tiris and rescue Erinze.

Tiris was taken into the Avalitya Shell and disappeared in a chrono-leap. It must be somewhere in this era. Merrouf seems to know where the Avalitya Shell appears. In the future, he said, "In this era, I should be in Asterries."

Avalitya Shell is believed to be in the "Basilica of Blessings", an important base of the Bafaria Order. The only way to get there is to use the transfer device in the Temple of Asterries. There's no other way than to get permission to use it. Let's talk to a high-ranking priest inside the temple.
There seems to be a request from Ryugelio. Again, there are many things I want to know about what happened after Abaritiashell appeared in the cathedral. Let's hear the story first.

Jake, who was entrusted with the Coin Inn, struggled with the unfamiliar work.
Feeling sorry for him, Fest offered to help him out.
Of course, there will be a reward, but above all, if the Coin Inn goes out of business, it would be a total loss.
The leader and his wife of the Jillwet troupe were worried about Charlotte, whom they had loved like their own children. Respond to their feelings and find a way to contact Charlotte.

Top adventurer Jake continues to receive requests.
I decided to take over one of the requests on behalf of him who couldn't make time to manage the coin restaurant.
Well, what is the content! ?

A demi-dragon appears in the Asteria plains! Suddenly the adventurers are excited. A person who snorts to make a name for himself. Those who shy away from thinking they can't do it. Meanwhile, it was that boy who appeared dashingly at them.
A sudden order to return to Tiris and Erinze. Even if it's just a detour to make memories of this era... What is their last wish?

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Before returning to the future, Erinze revealed the truth. She is the princess of the Bafarian tribe. It is said that the "God" who once built an advanced civilization and gave birth to humans still lives beyond the sky. They direct the Order of Bafalia through oracles and retrieve engrams from the Abaritia sealed away in the Holy Land. However, as a result, the distortion caused by Abaritia accumulated, leading to the destruction of the planet. Erinze wanted to release this cause and effect and explore a new future. Although it was only for a short time, Erinze told me that the trip with them was "fun". There was a faint glint in Feste's eyes when he heard that. At the Chronogate on the top floor, Bachelard was waiting. The face was familiar. The man I saw in my dream--the man who took the screaming boy's mother away. As soon as Bachelard glanced at us, he attacked without saying a word. Tiris is also beaten away, and Erinze is put into a coma. And Bachelard took only Erinze and made a chronoleap. A voice from Imagineseed was heard in the place left behind. "Help Erinze" "She will be used in the 'plan'" The voice does not answer the question. However, Erinze cannot be left alone. It is said that Charlotte will open the way to the future. Let's hurry to the Kaltoum Ruins to meet her.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ In addition to Charlotte and Carvein, Einlein and York were also present in the Cartoum ruins. It seems that an oracle was sent to Einlein and that he was waiting here. Charlotte followed the oracle and entrusted me with the pendant. Inside was a chronogram of high purity that even Tiris was surprised by. It is said that even if everyone chrono-leaps, it still has more power. With this, I can rescue Erinze. After thanking Charlotte and the others, we decided to head to the future from the ``Kamikake no Mihashira''.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I could see the laboratory where the Avalitya Shell was installed. Already at the final stage, a black haze began to grow from Avalitya Shell to Erinze with Bachelard's signal. Tiris jumped in and rescued Erinze in the nick of time. However, this time Tiris is caught by Avalitya Shell. An alarm rang out, and Bashlar gave instructions, but the Avalitya Shell didn't stop moving. Unable to reach Tilith's outstretched hand, she was swallowed by the Avalitya Shell. The next moment, Abaritia Shell emitted a dazzling light and disappeared without a trace. According to Bachelard, Avalitya Shell jumped from here 1000 years ago to their own era. Moreover, the space-time is disturbed by its influence, and it is not possible to chrono-leap and chase it. In the stalemate, Merlouf came along with Hrelbe. After understanding all the circumstances, he said, "I'll make it possible for Chronoleap." Half in doubt, I headed for Chronogate, and indeed the space-time was stable. Chrono Leap is possible with this. Bachelard has proposed a cooperative relationship with the goal of capturing the Abaritia Shell. Erinze seemed emotionally unwilling to nod, but she gave priority to saving Tiris and accepted the proposal. Bachelard's support, such as the preparation of the chronogram, was essential for the rescue of Tiris. Leaving Hrelbe on guard, I performed Chronoleap with Erinze again. Our destination is our time. We must find Avalitya Shell and Tiris, who should be there.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I found Merlouf by asking people in town. About half a year ago, Merlouf sensed an abnormal outbreak of engrams in the Basilica of Blessed Blessings, located underground on St. Bafalia Island. Probably from Avalitya Shell. According to Ehrinze, the Avalitya Shell jumps through time and space without using chronograms. Because of that, it is thought that the times have shifted and history has changed in half a year. The Temple of Blessings is an important base of the Bafarian religion. The only way to get there is via the Temple of Asterries. I don't know if I'll get permission, but let's go to the temple anyway.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Discovered the Avalitya Shell in the deepest part of the "Cathedral of Heavenly Blessings". Einlein put up a barrier and confined Avalitya Shell. This will prevent it from moving around on its own. Tiris is sleeping half-buried in the Avalitya Shell. We have not yet reached full integration. However, someday Avalitya Shell will wake up and take in Tiris. Before that, we must find a way to isolate Tirith. Otherwise, the world will face the future of destruction. If there was no way to save Tiris—if there was no way to avoid future destruction—what would you do? Looking for words to answer Feste's question. In this world, at the end of this journey, what will I find?

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Tilith was contacted by a person named Bachelard. It seems that he was giving instructions to Tiris from 1000 years in the future. When I reported the Voldigen incident, Bachelard worried about Erinze and issued an order to return to the future. The release of Abaritia will also be suspended in order to prioritize Erinze's safety. Tilith asked me to send the two of them to the Divine Pillar as her "last request". If the two go back to the future, they will never see each other again. It's sad to say goodbye... but it can't be helped.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ Ready to jump into the future. Let's head to Chronogate in "Kamikake no Onbashira".

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ I was able to hear about Erinze and Bachelard from Tiris. Bashlar and Tiris belong to the ideological group called "Zorxia" within the Bafarian tribe. Tiris' original mission was to guard and monitor Erinze. However, as he learned more about Erinze's personality, Tiris became attracted to her and began to serve her wholeheartedly. Tiris' desire to help Erinze is real. I'm sure it's also passed on to Erinze. After Chrono Leap, we finally came to the future after 1000 years. Let's hurry to Erinze.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ 1000 years later, in "The Pillar of Gods", I met the dragon race Furelbe again. It is said that she lost her memory during this time and served Erinze together with Tiris. Hrelbe was about to head to the research facility to help the kidnapped Erinze. As I accompanied him, Hrelbe told me about Bachelard's plans. It is the "Abaritia Shell Project". The idea was to fuse Erinze with a special "Abaritia Shell" to control other Abaritia. Of course, there were many opposing opinions, and in the end it was decided that Erinze would release Avalitya. However, even that was Bachelard's speculation. As a result of releasing Abaritia and activating the biometric engram, Erinze was in a state where it was easier to fuse with the Abaritia shell. The fusion of Erinze and Avalitya Shell is still underway. We must reach the research facility as soon as possible and stop the plan.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ We have reached the first floor of the “Kamikake no Onbashira”. However, the entrance to the research facility is closed. There, the figure of Bachelard was projected. Bachelard is determined to proceed with the Avaritia Shell Project. It wasn't to control Abaritia. The real purpose is to destroy the overdeveloped civilization, the "Beast of the Planet". Controlling a beast that exists in the imaginary world, not in a fairy tale, was the entirety of the Avalitya Shell Project. In order to protect the planet and civilization, Bachelard tells him that Erinze's sacrifice is unavoidable. However, Tiris does not accept that, and clearly says, "I want to help Erinze." The soldiers sent by Bachelar were taken over by Hrelbe. It is said that you should be able to get to the research facility by following the traces of her rampage. We are one step away from saving Erinze.
◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ There doesn't seem to be any noticeable changes in Asterries. Going to the future seems like a lie. Let's go to the coin store to gather information.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ When I arrived at the Coin Inn, the owner was about to leave. Jake is taking care of him when he's out, but it seems that there was talk of closing the store for a while. It seems that the innkeeper will be absent for a while. When I asked, Jake told me an amazing story. Duke Bernhardt was assassinated during an attack by dragons. What's more, the main culprit is Karvain, who has even been issued a wanted list. The King must have been sick and recuperating. There is no fact that he was assassinated in a dragon attack incident, and of course there is no way Carvain would assassinate him. However, there is a discrepancy with the history we know. After all, it may have been influenced by Avalitya Shell. Find Merlouf immediately and ask him where Avalitya Shell is.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ At the temple, the head priest Ryugelio was waiting. He easily gave me permission to use the transfer device and told me to go to the 'Basilica of Blessings'. It seems that Einlein has received the oracle, and that the Bafaria cult will cooperate fully. It seems that Einlein is also in the "Basilica of Heavenly Grace". Let's go and listen to the details.

◇ ◇ ◇ ◇ In the "Cathedral of Heavenly Grace", Einlein had set up a barrier. It is said that it is to put the "God's messenger" who appeared half a year ago to sleep. Originally, it should have been set up closer, but it seems that the monster inside is preventing the angel from approaching. "Eliminate the monster and curb the angel's wrath" is the oracle that Einlein received. Upon hearing this, Erinze guessed that Bachelard had given instructions to the cult in the form of an oracle. In any case, there is no doubt that Tiris and Avalitya Shell are here. In order to save Tiris, it is necessary to go to the innermost part.
Run with Your Swimsuits! Bright Summer!

Hi! "Is your adventure going well?"
My name is Warren. His partner is Carnera.
He's an errand for the collector "King Collector"!
We are currently collecting "pieces of ancient murals" under the orders of our master.
If you don't mind, could you lend me a hand?
Accept our requests and get more "Ancient Mural Pieces"! "Please take care of me, haha!"

Haha! "The King Collector's messenger, Warren!"
Have you gathered the "pieces of the ancient mural"?
Actually, I just found a big chunk of pieces. But there are monsters nearby.
With my body, which is biased toward beauty, I can't stand my hands or feet!
what about? "Could you please collect the 'Ancient Mural Piece' instead of me?"

Haha! "The King Collector's messenger, Warren!"
It's hard! A powerful rival has appeared to collect "Ancient Mural Pieces"!
The goblins of "<value type="locationName" id="fld002_E"/> are restoring the mural just like us!
Some people are stealing pieces for that reason.
I can't leave you alone! "Defeat them and take back the stolen "Ancient Mural Pieces"!"

Hey there! Are you fully enjoying Astelries' summer?
My name is Varen, and my partner is Karnera.
I am an emissary of the collector known as 'King Collector'!
I know this is sudden, but do you happen to have a swimsuit?
If you don't, how about taking on a simple request?
As a reward, I'll let you rent a nice swimsuit!
When it comes to summer, it's all about swimsuits! Don't miss this wave! Hahaha!

Hahaha! I'm Varen, the emissary of the 'King Collector'!
What comes to mind when you think of summer? The beach? The sun? Or perhaps physical beauty?
Of course, they're all correct, but there's one thing you can't miss out on!
That's the summer adventure!
A scorching gaze invites a blazing summer fantasy...
However, there are those who try to steal away our intense summer gaze.
Adventurer, could you protect our summer?

Hahaha! I'm Varen, the emissary of the 'King Collector'!
Thanks to you defeating the Shell Goblin, we were supposed to have the gaze of summer all to ourselves... But...
It's not enough... Summer is not just about this!
The radiance of swimsuits! The intense gazes directed at us! Oh, summer, don't go away!
We can't let the Shell Goblin steal away our summer!
Come on, let's defeat more and more! The gaze of summer will be fixated on you!
